reporting-org.narrative: CIVIL INITIATIVES FOR DEVELOPMENT AND PEACE INDIA

title.narrative: STITCH-India

description.narrative: As the Sustainable Textile Initiative: Together for Change (STITCH) consortium, we envision a global garment industry that contributes to an equal and just society by respecting human rights in the world of work. The global garment industry is fragmented and complex, involving many actors across the globe, with varying levels of power and influence. This activity relates to Cividep's work contributing to India under STITCH.

title.narrative: Number of common positions and joint statements submitted for policies, laws or guiding principles on main Lobby and Advocacy goals/strategies

description.narrative: Any formal joint statements or common positions shared by STITCH with outside stakeholders as part of lobby and advocacy efforts. This is a joint activity indicator (with contributions from multiple STITCH partners), and is only reported by this STITCH partner to avoid double counting

title.narrative: The number of functional coalitions/networks/platforms in which STITCH participates.

description.narrative: Coalitions are partnerships among distinct actors that coordinate action in pursuit of shared goals. Networks are forms of organization characterized by voluntary and reciprocal patterns of communication and exchange. The platform is a declaration of the principles on which a group of persons stands. This is a joint activity indicator (with contributions from multiple STITCH partners), and is only reported by this STITCH partner to avoid double counting

title.narrative: The number of times multi-stakeholder structures have convened to have dialogue about key industry issues.

description.narrative: Multi-stakeholder structures are country level/locally driven structures with partnership from multiple stakeholders such as trade unions, government, embassies, brands, suppliers, CSOs etc. This is a joint activity indicator (with multiple STITCH partners), and is only reported by this STITCH partner to avoid double counting
